p: The ears of the mice were fixed in 10% neutral formalin for 24 h. The tissues were processed with alcohol and xylene series and embedded in paraffin. The paraffin blocks were sectioned at 2 μm, and then stained with hematoxylin and eosin, and examined under microscopy ( Kang et al., 2017). Histological changes (acanthosis, thickening of the subepidermal layer, cellular infiltration) were evaluated semiquantitatively on a grade of 1–5 (1 = no change from negative control group; 5 = maximum change).
